page.title: 05Farming in Louth
page.content: Crop spraying,stubble burning,hedge removal studied at Grange farm Louth. Total acreage 1099_arable.Winter wheat and Barley,Linseed,Rape,Sprouts and Peas are grown most.It costs Â£5_Â£10 to spray an average field depending on chemicals used. It is much cheaper than ground spraying. Weed killers and Fungicides are safe. Insecticides can kill plants,animals.Farmers cut hedges every year to prevent overgrowth.Very few are taken down without reasons. Stubble burning could be eliminated_ new chopper reduces stubble to 3 pieces which can be ploughed in.Farmers NR Louth do not have to notify the fire brigade when burning stubble. East Lindsey council established a model law consisting of 10 rules.For broken rules up to Â£2000 fine is payable.
